title: Midday Session
commentary: Rally extends into midday: Dow jumps 0.5% to 49,623 as rate-cut hopes resurface after soft housing data. Gold surges to session highs (+0.8%) at $5,240, silver follows (+0.7%) to $88.75 as real yields dip. Crypto remains the laggard—Bitcoin drops to $63,520 (-1.5%) with large exchange inflows signaling more selling pressure ahead. Oil trims gains to +0.3% at $66.35 as dollar steadies. Markets now pricing 60% chance of May Fed cut, up from 45% yesterday.

title: Morning Session
commentary: Early buyers emerge: S&P climbs 0.3% to 49,560 as economic data shows resilient consumer spending despite tariff headwinds. Gold pushes higher (+0.5%) to $5,224 reclaiming ground after Tuesday's profit-taking—haven bid persists. Bitcoin slides further to $63,850 (-1.0%) as Grayscale outflows accelerate; ETH follows at -0.8%. Silver gains traction (+0.4%) to $88.55 on industrial demand narrative. Oil holds +0.5% at $66.50 as traders eye EIA inventory data due this afternoon.

title: Wednesday Open
commentary: Markets open cautiously after Tuesday's relief rally: S&P futures flat at 49,410 as traders await fresh tariff signals from the White House. Gold catches a bid (+0.3%) to $5,214 after overnight dip-buying in Asia, silver steady at $88.25. Bitcoin slips to $64,180 (-0.5%) as crypto digests mixed ETF flow data—Grayscale outflows persist. Oil edges higher (+0.4%) to $66.40 on renewed Iran tensions. Dollar firm at 97.92 as markets brace for Wednesday volatility.

title: Market Close
commentary: Bulls close strong on Tuesday: S&P finishes up 1.0% at 49,427, Dow gains 0.9% to 49,276 as Monday's tariff rout becomes a distant memory. Gold settles back (-0.6%) to $5,198 in healthy profit-taking after 3% Monday surge, while silver outshines (+1.4%) at $88.30 on dual haven-industrial appeal. Bitcoin finds footing at $64,520 (+0.4%) as whale supply shock digests—ETF flows stabilizing. Oil flat at $66.15, dollar steady at 97.83 as risk-on sentiment dominates the close.

title: Late Afternoon
commentary: Markets grind higher into final hour: S&P climbs 0.9% to 49,380, Nasdaq jumps 1.0% as Monday's tariff panic fully reverses. Gold extends correction (-0.7%) to $5,192 as safe-haven unwind accelerates, but silver holds gains (+1.2%) at $88.10 on resilient industrial demand. Bitcoin stabilizes at $64,480 (+0.3%) as selling pressure eases—early adopter whale dumps absorbed. Oil flat at $66.12 as geopolitical premium fades. Dollar steady at 97.82 as risk appetite returns.

title: Late Session
commentary: Bulls running strong into the close: Dow up 0.9% to 49,254, S&P gains 0.8% as risk appetite fully reverses Monday's tariff rout. Bitcoin bounces to $64,428 (+0.3%) unfazed by Putin signing law allowing Russian courts to confiscate crypto—geopolitical noise shrugged off. Silver cools slightly but holds green (+0.8%) at $87.30 while gold treads water (-0.9%) at $5,178. Oil pares losses to -0.4% at $66. Dollar firm at 97.84 as equity rally dominates FX flows.

title: Afternoon Session
commentary: Rally gains momentum into the afternoon: Dow surges 0.9% to 49,223, S&P climbs 0.8% as buyers overwhelm Monday's tariff panic. Silver continues outperforming (+1.6%) to $87.94 while gold pares losses (-0.9%) to $5,178. Bitcoin holds steady at $64,248 as ETF inflows stabilize—break-even traders caught in waiting game. Oil slips 0.8% to $65.76 as demand concerns persist despite Iran tensions. Dollar flat at 97.79 as risk appetite returns.

title: Lunchtime Session
commentary: Dip-buying continues into lunch: Dow holds 0.7% gains at 49,151, S&P climbs 0.6% as traders shake off tariff jitters. Bitcoin rebounds to $64,220 (+0.4%) with UAE's second-largest bank reportedly eyeing BTC exposure—institutional interest persists despite hedge fund exodus. Gold extends correction (-1.4%) to $5,153 as safe-haven trade unwinds, but silver outperforms (+0.8%). Oil fades 0.6% to $65.93 on demand concerns. Dollar eases to 97.77 after testing highs.

title: Midday Rally
commentary: Wall Street extends morning gains as bargain hunters pile in: Dow surges 0.7% to 49,159, S&P up 0.5% clawing back Monday's tariff losses. Silver steals the metals spotlight (+1.5%) to $87.90 while gold continues profit-taking (-1.1%) to $5,170. Bitcoin stabilizes at $63,950 after oldest 2009 whale dumps $1.24B—market digesting the supply shock. Oil slips 0.6% to $65.90 as demand fears override Iran tensions. Dollar holds firm at 97.9 as traders await further tariff clarity.

title: Morning Session
commentary: Equities bounce off Monday's tariff-driven lows: Dow climbs 0.5% to 49,024, S&P edges higher as dip-buyers emerge. Gold extends pullback (-1.4%) to $5,151 after Monday's 3% moonshot, profit-taking inevitable. Crypto stabilizes with Bitcoin finding support at $63,600 after testing sub-$63K overnight—still down 6% from Friday's close. Silver holds green (+0.5%) outperforming gold as industrial demand narrative resurfaces. Dollar firms 0.2% as traders await fresh tariff salvos from the White House.
